authors: Sam Cunningham For The Daily Mail
description: Bournemouth have signed Lewis Grabban from Norwich City in an £8million deal, with the 27-year-old striker putting pen to paper on a three-and-a-half year contract.
title: Bournemouth re-sign Lewis Grabban from Norwich City for £8m
title_page: Bournemouth re-sign Lewis Grabban from Norwich City for £8m | Daily Mail Online
text:
Bournemouth have followed the £10million deal for Benik Afobe by spending £8m on bringing Lewis Grabban back from Norwich.
The 27-year-old striker scored 22 goals for Bournemouth in the Championship in 2013-14 to earn a £3m move to Carrow Road.
Boss Eddie Howe had three bids for him turned down last summer, and Grabban did his best to force a move back to the South Coast by leaving the team hotel without permission before a League Cup tie at Rotherham for which he had been named on the bench.
Bournemouth have signed Lewis Grabban (right) from Norwich on a three-and-a-half year contract
The 27-year-old Grabban (right) said that he 'can't wait to get going' after signing a three-and-a-half year deal
Grabban previously played for Bournemouth for two years, from 2012 to 2014, before moving to Norwich
So happy to have signed at Bmouth once again and can't wait to get going. 😁😁😁
Thanks for all the messages welcoming me back ❤️ 🍒 — Lewis Grabban (@grabbs22) January 11, 2016
That made Norwich manager Alex Neil determined not to sell but, with Grabban having scored just once since, he has decided to sanction the move to help finance his own pursuit of Everton’s Steven Naismith.
Howe said: ‘He’s someone who was popular in the dressing room and a strong motivator so we’re delighted to bring him back.’
And Grabben was happy to return to the club he left in 2014, he Tweeted: 'So happy to have signed at Bournemouth once again and can't wait to get going. Thanks for all the messages welcoming me back.'
And he had some nice words for the club he leaves behind and for the fans, he added on Twitter with a montage of pictures of Norwich promotion winning campaign last season: 'A few ups and downs... But I guess it wasn't all that bad. Thanks to all the Norwich fans giving me best wishes.'
As well as Afobe making his debut, Howe hopes to have international clearance for Juan Iturbe in time for the Argentinian international to face West Ham on Tuesday night.
West Ham boss Slaven Bilic believes Afobe will be a success at his new club — although he is well prepared to deal with him, having closely monitored the striker while he was at Wolves.
‘I’m not going to lie but the reason we know quite a lot about him is we played Wolves in the FA Cup,’ said Bilic, whose side won 1-0 on Saturday. ‘I have no doubt he will do well, but not against us!’
